Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) directly convert chemical energy to electricity with high electrical efficiency.

Sentencas: It involves gas transport through the porous electrode to the three-phase boundaries (TPB).

Sentencas: The tortuosity of gas transport relates the bulk diffusion of gas in free space to the effective diffusion coefficient of gas migrating through a porous material.

Sentencas: Therefore, determining the tortuosity is of great importance.

Sentencas: This paper tests button SOFCs with NiO-YSZ as anode material followed by dual beam-focused ion beam scanning electron microscopy (FIB-SEM) to obtain 2D serial slice images.
Titulo: Analysing Tortuosity for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anode Material: Experiments and Modeling

Sentencas: Based on processed 2D images and reconstructed 3D microstructure, the tortuosity is calculated using three approaches i.e., porosity-tortuosity correlations, voxel-based, and path-length-based approaches.
Titulo: Analysing Tortuosity for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anode Material: Experiments and Modeling

Sentencas: The test results show that a decrease in Ni content in the anode greatly decreases the cell performance due to a decreased percolated electronic phase.

Sentencas: The sample with low performance has high tortuosity.
